alert.note: Alert for Randolph (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 07 at 8:16PM CDT until April 12 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a Flood Advisory for the following river in Arkansas... Black River At Pocahontas affecting Randolph County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Black River At Pocahontas. * WHEN...From this evening to Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Agricultural lands along the river east and south of Pocahontas will be impacted by high water. Equipment and livestock should be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Friday the stage was 17.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 16.0 feet by Monday (April 10). - Action stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 7 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Crest Time Date Black River Pocahontas 17.0 17.0 Fri 7 PM 16.6 16.2 16.0 **FALLING** &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
